Events that occurred on 23 February.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1945 - A letter by J.R.R. Tolkien, "The Name Coventry", is published in the Catholic Herald.
1945 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 97b.
1961 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 229.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 284.
2009 - The 1997 documentary J.R.R. Tolkien is released on DVD in the UK.
2024 - It is announced that the online videogame The Lord of the Rings: Heroes of Middle-earth will be discontinued online.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
The Fellowship of the Ring travels south down the Anduin.
They are ambushed near Sarn Gebir at night. A frightened Gollum flees to the eastern bank and hides in the Emyn Muil. A flying shadow approaches but Legolas shoots it with the bow of Galadriel.
